sentences:
Sentence 0:
IBMX (100 microM), an inhibitor of PDE, whose effects mimic those of low Ca(2+) on phototransduction, increased responses of both rod-ON-BCs and cone-ON-BCs, suggesting that the distinct effects of low Ca(2+) described above are attributable to differential modulation of signal transfer from different types of photoreceptors to BCs.

Sentence 1:
Moreover, scotopic ERG P III responses, reflecting the rod activity, were potentiated both in low Ca(2+) and in the presence of IBMX (100 microM).
sentence_raw: IBMX (100 microM), an inhibitor of PDE, whose effects mimic those of low Ca(2+) on phototransduction, increased responses of both rod-ON-BCs and cone-ON-BCs, suggesting that the distinct effects of low Ca(2+) described above are attributable to differential modulation of signal transfer from different types of photoreceptors to BCs.
Moreover, scotopic ERG P III responses, reflecting the rod activity, were potentiated both in low Ca(2+) and in the presence of IBMX (100 microM).
